project.teaser: COLOSSUS paves the way for future European aviation products and services which are designed in a truly holistic approach and to thus provide a major contribution to the digital transformation of aviation and air transportation in order to enable European competitiveness...
project.objective:
COLOSSUS paves the way for future European aviation products and services which are designed in a truly holistic approach and to thus provide a major contribution to the digital transformation of aviation and air transportation in order to enable European competitiveness in a key industrial sector. The expected outcomes of COLOSSUS provide Europe’s aviation sector with the platform to develop new and breakthrough product and technology in a holistic system-of-systems approach.
Main technical objectives of COLOSSUS are: (1) To create a Transformative Digital Collaborative (TDC) Framework that allows European aviation to perform research, technology development and innovation in a holistic system-of-systems approach. The TDC Framework shall support modelling, analysis, optimisation and evaluation of complex products and services under consideration of real-world conditions.
(2) To expand and test the capabilities and performance of the TDC Framework with two Use Cases, both of which address needs identified in the Work Programme and thus possess a value of their own: Use Case 1: Creating a business model for sustainable 4D-intermodal mobility and evaluating the concept for performance, competitiveness, environmental impact and life cycle footprint. Use Case 2: Developing an integrated fast-response approach for preventing, detecting and fighting wildfires by combining latest developments in the fields of aircraft design and technology, automation, AI and digitalisation.
(3) To perform conceptual studies for two products which could be transverse technology enablers for multi-modal mobility and affordable decarbonisation of aviation: a multi-role seaplane with hybrid propulsion and a product for eVTOL-based advanced air mobility of passengers and goods.
project.title: Collaborative System of Systems Exploration of Aviation Products, Services and Business Models
project.keywords: System-of-Systems, Digitalization, Aircaft Desing, Digital Technologies, Collaborative Design, Agent Based Simulation, Optimization

result.title: Quality and Risk Management Plan
result.description: This deliverable will present the organization and management of the project in terms of activities deliverables timeline and risks

result.title: A Capability-Focused Approach To Model Complex, Multi-Layered Systems-of-Systems

details.authors: Martin Spieck, Ludvig K. Franzén, Kristian Amadori, Prajwal S. Prakasha and Nabih Naeem

result.title: Description of Ethics Requirements
result.description: Project management has to ensure that all ethics issues related to activities in the grant are addressed in compliance with ethical principles the applicable international and national law and the provisions set out in the Grant Agreement This deliverable will present the specific ethically relevant aspects and requirements of this project in particular with regard of protection of privacy the protection of personal data the right to nondiscrimination and the principle of proportionality

result.title: Technology Portfolio Report
result.description: The report to be delivered from this WP is a list of technologies that will be included within WP4 and WP5 and evaluated in WP2.7. The report will contain a consistent list of technologies, with belonging TRL, main factors (dependent on the technology domain) and applicability. The list should contain all relevant information to be able to include them in vehicle modeling (WP4) or at SoS level (WP5). So all input need to be quantifiable in order to be evaluated in WP2.7 based on the modelling and simulation from WP4 and WP5.

result.title: Website, Press Release and Templates for Presentations and Reports
result.description: Set-up of the Colossus website including a public and private part. Prepare templates for presentations, deliverables, minutes of meetings. Prepare press release. All these elements should be available at M6.

result.title: Stakeholder Identification and Definition
result.description: The aim is to identify all relevant stakeholders for both use cases to collected and defines relevant KPI that will be main input for scenario creation and evaluation The stakeholder identification will be performed by interview with the different partners and relevant external organizations

result.title: SOTA Holistic SoS Engineering
result.description: This deliverable aims at collecting the research forefront and industrial SOTA of holistic System-of-system engineering approaches and implementation. The findings within this deliverable are the foundation for the decision making of the to-be-realized approach and implementation within the COLOSSUS project.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - COLOSSUS (Collaborative System of Systems Exploration of Aviation Products, Services and Business Models)
result.teaser: COLOSSUS will develop a system-of-systems design methodology which for the first time will enable the combined optimization of aircraft, operations and business models. Resulting specific solutions for intermodal transport and wildfire-fighting as well as developed methods and...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

webItem.alternativeText: Multilevel System of System - Push - Pull Paradigm

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
